comments.body:
I like to do the decoding of the protobuf messages as part of processing the akka stream (compare `getLedgerEntries`), because then
1) the decoding only happens when demand for more messages is requested from the sink (i.e. the API consumer)
2) we don't do all the work upfront just to find out that the stream was broken.

Admittedly this is less of a problem for configuration than for transactions, but it'll ultimately be more sane to use the same "process".

For now, don't worry about it.
agree with the reasoning. I'll leave it as is for now though to land this beast...

To clarify my previous comment, I would make queries part of the implementation of this trait.
The downside of this is that many queries will be duplicated, and modifying a query in a DB-specific trait makes it easy to not modify the respective query in all the other traits.

For reference, I initially started out on the inheritance approach which duplicated a lot of code: https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/commit/754fd7b60985325571850c65c28171d35242d1a4#diff-3c124d60ef536a91fb6039a3d6b350aa and got worried about the maintainability of multiple DAOs.

But we should be able to come up with something more scoped, i.e. only overriding "non-standard" SQL statements. Let me take a stab at this and see how this turns out. This may be what @stefanobaghino-da means too.

Another alternative could be to try to avoid Postgres-special syntax. For the "on conflict .. do nothing" this can mean standardizing on the H2db approach of adding a where clause filter to achieve the same effect. I did not do so since I was worried about causing perf regressions on the Postgres side. This would turn

```
  private val SQL_INSERT_PACKAGE =
    dbType match {
      case Postgres =>
        """insert into packages(package_id, upload_id, source_description, size, known_since, ledger_offset, package)
          |select {package_id}, {upload_id}, {source_description}, {size}, {known_since}, ledger_end, {package}
          |from parameters
          |on conflict (package_id) do nothing
          |""".stripMargin
      case H2Database =>
        """insert into packages(package_id, upload_id, source_description, size, known_since, ledger_offset, package)
          |select {package_id}, {upload_id}, {source_description}, {size}, {known_since}, ledger_end, {package}
          |from parameters
          |where {package_id} not in (select package_id from packages)
          |""".stripMargin
    }
```

to:

```
  private val SQL_INSERT_PACKAGE =
    """insert into packages(package_id, upload_id, source_description, size, known_since, ledger_offset, package)
      |select {package_id}, {upload_id}, {source_description}, {size}, {known_since}, ledger_end, {package}
      |from parameters
      |where {package_id} not in (select package_id from packages)""".stripMargin
```
